intro: Homalium hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Hildebrandt's huito, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a deciduous tree or shrub that can grow up to 15 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural collections.
